intro: Campyloneurum pentaphyllum, commonly known as the five-lobed fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found on rock surfaces or in moist, shaded forest areas. Its leaves are usually bright green and have a distinctive, intricate pattern of lobes. This fern is well adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, where it plays a role in maintaining ecological balance.
